DataElement.preferredDefinition: The explanation regarding the reason the specimen being submitted for testing does not meet a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a specimen being submitted.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration.

Concepts.definition: The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: released; merged information from duplicate DEC #2012957

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of low value or worth.: A dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.: An essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone; a degree or grade of excellence or worth.

Concepts.definition: Of low value or worth.
A dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.
An essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone; a degree or grade of excellence or worth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than forty-nine and less than fifty-one and the quantity that it denotes.: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than forty-nine and less than fifty-one and the quantity that it denotes.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

Concepts.definition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.
An essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone; a degree or grade of excellence or worth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.: How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

Concepts.definition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: On the inside; contained in.: A saturated solution of formaldehyde, water, and typically another agent, most commonly methanol. In its typical form, formalin is 37% formaldehyde by weight (40% by volume), 6-13% methanol, and the rest water.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
On the inside; contained in.

A saturated solution of formaldehyde, water, and typically another agent, most commonly methanol. In its typical form, formalin is 37% formaldehyde by weight (40% by volume), 6-13% methanol, and the rest water.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not existing; not able to be found.: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: The procedure of having an identity established.

Concepts.definition: Not existing; not able to be found.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
The procedure of having an identity established.
